name: 吳傳威
objective:
本課程探討結構元件以及結構系統之穩定問題，諸如柱、梁柱、圓環、剛架及平板等。同時，非線性挫曲後行為亦予介紹。
This course discusses the stability problems of structural members as well as structural systems such as columns, beam-columns, frames, rings, and plates. In the mean times, the nonlinear post buckling behaviors are also introduced.
schedule:
1st. Week Introductions
2nd Week 228 Holiday
3rd. Week Methods of analysis
4th. Week Buckling of columns
5th. Week Buckling of columns
6th. Week Approximate method
7th. Week DEM Models
8th. Week Spring break
9th. Week Initial post-buckling behaviors
10th. Week Midterm exam
11th. Week Buckling of beam- columns.
12th. Week Buckling of frames
13th. Week Buckling of frames
14th. Week Buckling of rings
15th. Week Buckling of confined rings
16th. Week Buckling of plates
17th. Week Final report I
18th. Week Final report II
scorePolicy:
1. Midterm exam. 30%
2. Home work       20%
3. Class attendant 10 %
4. Final reports     40%
materials:
Textbook：
1.“Principles of Structural Stability Theory”, by Alexander Chajes.
References：
1. “Stress, Stability and Chaos in Structural Engineering: an Energy Approach”, by M. S. El Naschie, (and C. W. Wu).
2.“Theory of Elastic Stability”, by S. P. Timoshenko and James M. Gere.
3. Others
remarks: 本學期原則採實體授課方式； 因應疫情警戒標準，本學期教學及授課方式請依照學校網頁所公布之訊息為準： (https://oaa.ntut.edu.tw/p/404-1008-98622.php?Lang=zh-tw)
